definition: letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China

sentences.english: Such symbols as we use in maths are Greek letters.
sentences.chinese: 我們在數學中常用的這些符號是希臘字母。

sentences.english: L It is the Greek letter for L.
sentences.chinese: 其實λ就是希臘字母中的。

sentences.english: A long torn twisted strip of papyrus, on which a column of Greek letters are written.
sentences.chinese: 一長條扭曲破裂的紙莎草紙，上面寫着一排希臘字母。

sentences.english: They just party a lot. They group up in these Greek letters.
sentences.chinese: 他們經常出去玩，而這些組織都是用希臘字母命名的。

sentences.english: In two thousand five, Greek letters had to be used for the first time to name storms in the Atlantic.
sentences.chinese: 在兩千五，希臘字母來命名風暴在大西洋首次使用。

sentences.english: I'm helped with the alphabet by the fact I speak Russian.
sentences.chinese: 我能閱讀希臘字母是由於我說俄語。

sentences.english: Omega is the last letter of the Greek alphabet.
sentences.chinese: Omega是希臘字母表中的最後一個字母。

sentences.english: But, in most chemistry texts, it's also chi.
sentences.chinese: 在大多數化學教材上，也有用希臘字母X表示的。
